senses.de: To control or manage by making rules
senses.ex: The government regulates the financial industry to protect consumers.

Tips.title: Regulatory Authority
Tips.description: Explains how 'regulate' often refers to actions of governments or organizations.
Tips.example: Only the FDA can regulate the pharmaceuticals market.

Tips.title: Rule Creation
Tips.description: Highlights 'regulate' involves making new rules, not just enforcing existing ones.
Tips.example: The board will regulate membership requirements next month.

Tips.title: Protection Motive
Tips.description: Emphasizes that regulation often aims to safeguard interests or welfare.
Tips.example: They regulate fishing to protect the marine ecosystem.

senses.de: To adjust to a specific level or degree
senses.ex: The device regulates the temperature in the room.

Tips.title: Fine-tuning
Tips.description: Points out regulation can involve subtle adjustments for improvement or balance.
Tips.example: Technicians regulate the sound system for optimal audio quality.

Tips.title: Balancing Act
Tips.description: Conveys that 'regulate' can mean maintaining things within a range, not extremes.
Tips.example: The air conditioner regulates the temperature to stay comfortable.

senses.de: To make an apparatus, system, or process work more efficiently
senses.ex: The engineers are working to regulate the machine's performance.

Tips.title: Efficiency Focus
Tips.description: Stresses that in technical contexts, 'regulate' means making something run more efficiently.
Tips.example: The new algorithm regulates data flow to improve processing speed.

Tips.title: System's Harmony
Tips.description: Implies regulation ensures parts of a system work well together.
Tips.example: This component regulates energy distribution within the device.

senses.de: To correct or adjust the time of a clock, watch, etc.
senses.ex: He regulated his watch to match the local time zone.

Tips.title: Time Precision
Tips.description: Indicates 'regulate' is about making accurate time-related adjustments.
Tips.example: I need to regulate my wall clock to avoid being late again.

Tips.title: Local Synchronization
Tips.description: Mentions how 'regulate' can ensure time devices align with a specific time zone.
Tips.example: After landing in Paris, I'll regulate my watch to local time.

Adjust.wordDefinition:
Adjust means to change something slightly to make it work better or to fit better.

It is usually used in situations where there are small changes that need to be made. For example, you might adjust the temperature on your thermostat to make your home more comfortable.

To sum up, you would use adjust when you need to make small changes to something, and regulate when you need to ensure something is working properly according to specific rules or standards.

Balance.wordDefinition:
Balance refers to the equal distribution, amount, or weight of things. For example, balancing your budget means ensuring that your income and expenses are equal, and balancing a scale means making sure both sides weigh the same.

Both words are applicable in different situations; balance is used when referring to things being equal or evenly distributed, while regulate is used when referring to the control, adjustment or management of something.

Control.wordDefinition:
Control refers to having power over something or someone and the ability to make decisions about it, while regulate refers to setting rules or guidelines that govern how something works or behaves.

Control can be applicable in situations where one needs to have authority over others, such as in a management position, or in situations where one needs to exert physical or mental control, such as in sports or medical treatment.

Control refers to having power over something or someone, while regulate refers to setting rules or guidelines that govern how something works or behaves.

Direct.wordDefinition:
Direct means to give guidance or instructions on how something should be done. For example, a teacher may direct a student on how to complete a task.

Direct is applicable when someone needs guidance to complete a task or achieve a goal. Regulate is applicable when there are rules or standards that need to be followed to ensure safety, fairness, or some other important consideration.

Govern.wordDefinition:
Govern means to control or manage something, typically a government or organization. It involves making decisions about policies and laws, as well as enforcing them.

For example, a government may govern a country by making decisions about taxes, education, and foreign policy. Meanwhile, they may regulate industries such as food production by setting standards for food safety and labeling.

Govern refers to the overall control or management of something, while regulate refers to the specific rules or standards that are put in place to ensure order and safety.

Manage.wordDefinition:
Both manage and regulate refer to controlling something, but in different ways.

Manage means to oversee, handle, or take charge of something, like a business or a team. It involves taking action to achieve specific goals, making decisions, delegating tasks, and setting priorities.

In summary, managing is about taking control and making decisions, while regulating is about setting rules and enforcing them to ensure consistency and fair play.

Moderate.wordDefinition:
Moderate means to keep something within reasonable limits or to avoid extreme behavior. For example, you can moderate your food intake to maintain good health.

Moderate refers to self-control or keeping something in check while regulate refers to external control or governing of something.

Standardize.wordDefinition: Standardize means to make things the same or uniform according to a set of standards or specifications. For example, a company might standardize the sizes of their clothing to make sure they fit consistently.

Supervise.wordDefinition:
Supervise means to oversee or monitor a certain activity to ensure it is being carried out properly. For example, a supervisor at a factory may supervise workers to ensure they are following safety guidelines and using equipment correctly.

Regulate is used to create rules or laws, while supervise is used to monitor and enforce those rules or laws.

Systematize.wordDefinition:
Systematize means to organize or arrange something according to a system or method. For example, a teacher may systematize their lesson plans by organizing them in a specific order.

Regulate is applicable when talking about controlling or managing something in order to ensure it meets certain standards or requirements, while systematize is applicable when talking about organizing something in a structured and efficient manner.

quotes.Text: Those who want the Government to regulate matters of the mind and spirit are like men who are so afraid of being murdered that they commit suicide to avoid assassination.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Harry S Truman

quotes.Text: For more than a century, states have sought to protect the integrity of the democratic process at the state and local level by regulating corporate spending in elections.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Eric Schneiderman

quotes.Text: I am for a clear distinction between public and private life. I believe private matters should be regulated in private and I have asked those close to me to respect this.
quotes.Title: French Statesman
quotes.Name: Francois Hollande

quotes.Text: I work out hard; that way, I can eat whatever I want. If you have a hard time regulating your diet, pushing yourself at the gym will help you keep the pounds off.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Gretchen Bleiler

quotes.Text: To love our neighbor as ourselves is such a truth for regulating human society, that by that alone one might determine all the cases in social morality.
quotes.Title: English Philosopher
quotes.Name: John Locke

quotes.Text: From the day an idea is conceptualized to the day the technology is built, carried out, and regulated, it's important to have that human awareness.
quotes.Title: Chinese Scientist
quotes.Name: Fei-Fei Li

quotes.Text: The idea that the world can unite without being regulated is clearly an illusion.
quotes.Title: Belgian Statesman
quotes.Name: Guy Verhofstadt

quotes.Text: It's important to eat healthy fats to regulate hunger.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Mandy Ingber

quotes.Text: You can't regulate every lab in the world.
quotes.Title: English Physicist
quotes.Name: Stephen Hawking

quotes.Text: I like that the art world isn't regulated.
quotes.Title: American Critic
quotes.Name: Jerry Saltz
